text.p: Sembawang Corp Ltd is proposing to make a voluntary takeover offer for all Sembawang Maritime Ltd (SML) shares at Singapore S$3.70 a share and all outstanding SML convertible unsecured loanstock (CULS) at S$1.23 each.

A statement from Standard Chartered Merchant Bank Asia Ltd, acting for SembCorp said Thursday, that the offer price for the shares and CULS represent a premium of 14.9 percent and 23.0 percent respectively over their last transacted prices of S$3.22 and S$1 each.
The offer is conditional upon SembCorp getting approval of its shareholders in a general meeting unless a waiver is obtained from the Stock Exchange of Singapore.
As at Aug 22, SembCorp owns 33.1 million SML shares or about 33.2 percent of the company and S$24.8 million principal amount of CULS which may be converted into 8.3 million new SML shares.
Parties acting in concert with SembCorp own 2.6 million SML shares or 2.6 percent. SembCorp and concert parties own in aggregate 35.7 million shares or 35.8 percent of SML.
SembCorp intends to finance the offer from internal resources and bank borrowings, said the statement.
